associate_public_ip_address.description: (LC) Associate a public ip address with an instance in a VPC

availability_zone.description: A list of one or more availability zones for the group. Used for EC2-Classic and default subnets when not specified with `vpc_zone_identifier` argument. Conflicts with `vpc_zone_identifier`

block_device_mappings.description: (LT) Specify volumes to attach to the instance besides the volumes specified by the AMI

capacity_rebalance.description: Indicates whether capacity rebalance is enabled

cpu_options.description: (LT) The CPU options for the instance

create_asg.description: Determines whether to create autoscaling group or not

create_lc.description: Determines whether to create launch configuration or not

create_lt.description: Determines whether to create launch template or not

credit_specification.description: (LT) Customize the credit specification of the instance

default_cooldown.description: The amount of time, in seconds, after a scaling activity completes before another scaling activity can start

default_version.description: (LT) Default Version of the launch template

delete_timeout.description: Delete timeout to wait for destroying autoscaling group

desired_capacity.description: The number of Amazon EC2 instances that should be running in the autoscaling group

disable_api_termination.description: (LT) If true, enables EC2 instance termination protection

ebs_block_device.description: (LC) Additional EBS block devices to attach to the instance

ebs_optimized.description: If true, the launched EC2 instance will be EBS-optimized

elastic_gpu_specifications.description: (LT) The elastic GPU to attach to the instance

elastic_inference_accelerator.description: (LT) Configuration block containing an Elastic Inference Accelerator to attach to the instance

enabled_metrics.description: A list of metrics to collect. The allowed values are `GroupDesiredCapacity`, `GroupInServiceCapacity`, `GroupPendingCapacity`, `GroupMinSize`, `GroupMaxSize`, `GroupInServiceInstances`, `GroupPendingInstances`, `GroupStandbyInstances`, `GroupStandbyCapacity`, `GroupTerminatingCapacity`, `GroupTerminatingInstances`, `GroupTotalCapacity`, `GroupTotalInstances`

enclave_options.description: (LT) Enable Nitro Enclaves on launched instances

ephemeral_block_device.description: (LC) Customize Ephemeral (also known as 'Instance Store') volumes on the instance

force_delete.description: Allows deleting the Auto Scaling Group without waiting for all instances in the pool to terminate. You can force an Auto Scaling Group to delete even if it's in the process of scaling a resource. Normally, Terraform drains all the instances before deleting the group. This bypasses that behavior and potentially leaves resources dangling

health_check_grace_period.description: Time (in seconds) after instance comes into service before checking health

health_check_type.description: `EC2` or `ELB`. Controls how health checking is done

hibernation_options.description: (LT) The hibernation options for the instance

iam_instance_profile_arn.description: (LT) The IAM Instance Profile ARN to launch the instance with

iam_instance_profile_name.description: The name attribute of the IAM instance profile to associate with launched instances

image_id.description: The AMI from which to launch the instance

initial_lifecycle_hooks.description: One or more Lifecycle Hooks to attach to the Auto Scaling Group before instances are launched. The syntax is exactly the same as the separate `aws_autoscaling_lifecycle_hook` resource, without the `autoscaling_group_name` attribute. Please note that this will only work when creating a new Auto Scaling Group. For all other use-cases, please use `aws_autoscaling_lifecycle_hook` resource

instance_initiated_shutdown_behavior.description: (LT) Shutdown behavior for the instance. Can be `stop` or `terminate`. (Default: `stop`)

instance_market_options.description: (LT) The market (purchasing) option for the instance

instance_refresh.description: If this block is configured, start an Instance Refresh when this Auto Scaling Group is updated

instance_type.description: The type of the instance to launch

key_name.description: The key name that should be used for the instance

launch_configuration.description: Name of an existing launch configuration to be used (created outside of this module)

launch_template.description: Name of an existing launch template to be used (created outside of this module)

lc_name.description: Name of launch configuration to be created

lc_use_name_prefix.description: Determines whether to use `lc_name` as is or create a unique name beginning with the `lc_name` as the prefix

license_specifications.description: (LT) A list of license specifications to associate with

load_balancers.description: A list of elastic load balancer names to add to the autoscaling group names. Only valid for classic load balancers. For ALBs, use `target_group_arns` instead

lt_name.description: Name of launch template to be created

lt_use_name_prefix.description: Determines whether to use `lt_name` as is or create a unique name beginning with the `lt_name` as the prefix

lt_version.description: Launch template version. Can be version number, `$Latest`, or `$Default`

max_instance_lifetime.description: The maximum amount of time, in seconds, that an instance can be in service, values must be either equal to 0 or between 604800 and 31536000 seconds

max_size.description: The maximum size of the autoscaling group

metadata_options.description: Customize the metadata options for the instance

metrics_granularity.description: The granularity to associate with the metrics to collect. The only valid value is `1Minute`

min_elb_capacity.description: Setting this causes Terraform to wait for this number of instances to show up healthy in the ELB only on creation. Updates will not wait on ELB instance number changes

min_size.description: The minimum size of the autoscaling group

mixed_instances_policy.description: Configuration block containing settings to define launch targets for Auto Scaling groups

name.description: Name used across the resources created

network_interfaces.description: (LT) Customize network interfaces to be attached at instance boot time

placement_group.description: The name of the placement group into which you'll launch your instances, if any

placement_tenancy.description: (LC) The tenancy of the instance. Valid values are `default` or `dedicated`

protect_from_scale_in.description: Allows setting instance protection. The autoscaling group will not select instances with this setting for termination during scale in events.

ram_disk_id.description: (LT) The ID of the ram disk

root_block_device.description: (LC) Customize details about the root block device of the instance

security_groups.description: A list of security group IDs to associate

service_linked_role_arn.description: The ARN of the service-linked role that the ASG will use to call other AWS services

spot_price.description: (LC) The maximum price to use for reserving spot instances (defaults to on-demand price)

suspended_processes.description: A list of processes to suspend for the Auto Scaling Group. The allowed values are `Launch`, `Terminate`, `HealthCheck`, `ReplaceUnhealthy`, `AZRebalance`, `AlarmNotification`, `ScheduledActions`, `AddToLoadBalancer`. Note that if you suspend either the `Launch` or `Terminate` process types, it can prevent your Auto Scaling Group from functioning properly

tag_specifications.description: (LT) The tags to apply to the resources during launch

tags.description: A list of tag blocks. Each element should have keys named key, value, and propagate_at_launch

tags_as_map.description: A map of tags and values in the same format as other resources accept. This will be converted into the non-standard format that the aws_autoscaling_group requires.

target_group_arns.description: A set of `aws_alb_target_group` ARNs, for use with Application or Network Load Balancing

termination_policies.description: A list of policies to decide how the instances in the Auto Scaling Group should be terminated. The allowed values are `OldestInstance`, `NewestInstance`, `OldestLaunchConfiguration`, `ClosestToNextInstanceHour`, `OldestLaunchTemplate`, `AllocationStrategy`, `Default`

update_default_version.description: (LT) Whether to update Default Version each update. Conflicts with `default_version`

use_lc.description: Determines whether to use a launch configuration in the autoscaling group or not

use_lt.description: Determines whether to use a launch template in the autoscaling group or not

use_mixed_instances_policy.description: Determines whether to use a mixed instances policy in the autoscaling group or not

use_name_prefix.description: Determines whether to use `name` as is or create a unique name beginning with the `name` as the prefix

user_data.description: (LC) The user data to provide when launching the instance. Do not pass gzip-compressed data via this argument; see `user_data_base64` instead

user_data_base64.description: The Base64-encoded user data to provide when launching the instance

vpc_zone_identifier.description: A list of subnet IDs to launch resources in. Subnets automatically determine which availability zones the group will reside. Conflicts with `availability_zones`

wait_for_capacity_timeout.description: A maximum duration that Terraform should wait for ASG instances to be healthy before timing out. (See also Waiting for Capacity below.) Setting this to '0' causes Terraform to skip all Capacity Waiting behavior.

wait_for_elb_capacity.description: Setting this will cause Terraform to wait for exactly this number of healthy instances in all attached load balancers on both create and update operations. Takes precedence over `min_elb_capacity` behavior.
